results.title: A Shame like Alice. Parts. 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.

In March 1983 Focus spent one week in the Northern Territory looking at the living conditions of First Nations people in the most famous small town in Australia, Alice Springs. Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby.

results.title: Understanding is not enough
results.creator_credit: Alison Head, Keith Head, Uniting Church in Australia and Indignata Filmnic
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Uniting Church and the liaison work it is involved in with the First Nations people in Victoria. By interviewing those involved in the liaison work, the film examines the lived experience of some First Nations people in Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alison Head, Keith Head, Uniting Church in Australia and Indignata Filmnic

results.title: The Quinkins
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A group of First Nations storytellers combined their talents to create the pictures and sound for this traditional tale of conflict between the Imnims and the Timaras in Dreamtime. Uses the illustrations from the book of the same name by Dick Roughsey and Percy Trezise.

results.title: Northern Territory Contact. No. 12
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Solar village. In the little township of Nguiu, on Bathurst Island a solar power plant run by First Nations people, has been built, which supplies electricity to the settlement of 800 people.

results.title: Wool Fashion Award
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Against a background of beauty spots in Sydney, models display the winning styles in frocks, sportswear and costumes of the first fashion awards presented in Australia in 1956. Credits include: fashion adviser Pat Woodley; accessories by David Jones Ltd; photographed by George Heath; compered by Bob Pollard and edited by Sydney Whiteley.

results.title: Ask an Australian about her household [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life common to an Australian housewife in her household management, and the goods, services and types of housing available - (1970’s point-of-view). Note: young male child nude in shower scene, may not be suitable for public screening. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Me do
results.brief_description:
Gabrielle recounts her struggle to gain independence, aided by the love and support of her mother and eight siblings.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.

results.title: Heaven help us!
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: There’s only one thing wrong with telephones: people use them. This film sets out to explain the simple rules of telephone etiquette with special effects and fantasy sequences. Max Meldrum plays an angel, who for some reason is in charge of heaven’s communications systems! Using a shonky business as an example, he explains the do’s and dont’s of good communication over the phone. Produced for the Australian Post Office.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Kingsbury, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Game Masters: Peter Molyneux interview
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Peter Molyneux speaks about his career as a videogame designer. While selling baked beans, a once in a life time opportunity presented itself and Molyneux took advantage of his good fortune. His first game, ‘Populous’, became a huge worldwide success, surprising everyone, including himself. In this interview Peter talks about his inspirations, his work practise and his never-ending fascination with the notion of morality and choice. Now, as Creative Director of Microsoft Game Studios, Molyneux is one of the best known names in the videogames industry. Making his mark as a games designer and programmer, he has been responsible for a string of bestselling games, including ‘Populous’, ‘Dungeon Keeper’, ‘Black and White’ and ‘Fable I, II and III’.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
